title.narrative: National Animal Diseases Epidemiosurveillance System

description.narrative: APHIS improved the implementation and monitoring of animal disease surveillance systems with Guinea- Bissaus Directorate of Veterinary Services. This project enhanced the capabilities of the countrys Regional Disease Surveillance System.

title.narrative: McGovern-Dole Program

description.narrative: The McGovern-Dole program provides for the donation of agricultural commodities and the provision of financial and technical assistance to improve the education, food security and health of school-age children, especially girls, in developing countries.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Micronutrient-fortified Food Aid Products Pilot Program

description.narrative: The Micronutrient-Fortified Food Aid Products Pilot (MFFAPP) is administered under the McGovern-Dole Program. Under MFFAPP, participants will develop and field test new or improved micronutrient-fortified food aid products designed to meet the energy and nutrient needs of populations served by McGovern-Dole Program. Through this effort, USDA hopes to identify new products that would be readily available for distribution through the McGovern-Dole Program

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles
